Hey, guys, I just wanted to show off a mod I've been working on lately. Here are a list of features and a few screenshots. By the way, the map is currently a placeholder. I'm currently in negotations with a high profile mapper to help with this project. This is a very rough and very early version (I only have ~1 minute of gameplay at this point).

* Dragon's Lair (tm) style gameplay with a health system
* Full cinematic with all custom animation
* Seamless transitions between animation cycles
* Around 20 minutes in length (your mileage may vary)
* Full storyline (obviously)
* Checkpoint system
* Added gore

WIP Screenshots:

Map Scripting:


Example of a reflex sequence


I haven't come up with a name for the mod yet. I was thinking of Zombies' Lair in homage to Dragon's Lair. Also, if you are curious as of what I have done in the past, check the the Classic Doom for Doom 3 cinematics or a test machinima film I did a while back entitled Episodes: Episode 1.

I'll update this thread once I have cooler stuff to show. I'm just trying to gauge interest at this point.

post.author: bhenderson
post.body:
Hey, guys, I just wanted to show off a mod I've been working on lately. Here are a list of features and a few screenshots. By the way, the map is currently a placeholder. I'm currently in negotations with a high profile mapper to help with this project. This is a very rough and very early version (I only have ~1 minute of gameplay at this point).

* Dragon's Lair (tm) style gameplay with a health system
* Full cinematic with all custom animation
* Seamless transitions between animation cycles
* Around 20 minutes in length (your mileage may vary)
* Full storyline (obviously)
* Checkpoint system
* Added gore

WIP Screenshots:

Map Scripting:


Example of a reflex sequence


I haven't come up with a name for the mod yet. I was thinking of Zombies' Lair in homage to Dragon's Lair. Also, if you are curious as of what I have done in the past, check the the Classic Doom for Doom 3 cinematics or a test machinima film I did a while back entitled Episodes: Episode 1.

I'll update this thread once I have cooler stuff to show. I'm just trying to gauge interest at this point.
